coreFramework.frameworkIntro: Removing impediments is core to servant leadership:

rows.action: Identify type: Organizational (PM solves), Technical (team solves), or External (requires escalation).
If technical and within team expertise, facilitate but let THEM solve it. Don't micromanage.
If organizational/administrative, YOU remove it. Escalate to management, work with other departments.
Prioritize blockers that stop work RIGHT NOW. Some are urgent, some are important but not blocking.
After removing, ask: How do we prevent this blocker in the future? Root cause analysis.

pmbokConnection.quote: Servant leaders remove impediments and obstacles from the team

quotes.text: If it's a technical problem the team can solve, let the team solve it. If it's an administrative or organizational issue, YOU fix it. Don't give administrative work to the teamâ€”let them do what they do best.

fieldInsights.title: The Scrum Master's Core Job
fieldInsights.insight: In Agile, the Scrum Master's PRIMARY job is removing impediments. Not managing the backlog (that's PO). Not writing code (that's developers). Removing blockers so the team can sprint.

story.title: Clearing the Path to Summit
story.narrative: You're the route guide **CLEAR**ing obstacles on the mountain...

scenes.description: Avalanche blocking route? (Organizational - you handle with command). Two climbers debating which rope technique? (Technical - they can resolve).

scenes.visual: ğŸ‘¥ LET climbers resolve technical debates
scenes.description: If they can figure it out (rope methods, pace), facilitate but don't dictate. Your job isn't to solve every technical decision.

scenes.visual: â¬†ï¸ ESCALATE and remove the avalanche debris
scenes.description: Avalanche blocking the route? That's YOUR job. Call for avalanche team, clear the path, establish safety. Organizational blocker you must handle.

scenes.visual: âš¡ ACT on what's blocking ascent NOW
scenes.description: Prioritize. Route blocked by avalanche > minor gear dispute. What stops the climb TODAY gets fixed first.

scenes.visual: ğŸ”„ REVIEW how to prevent future blocks
scenes.description: Why did avalanche hit here? Unstable snowpack? Mark danger zones so next expedition avoids it. Prevention.

story.moral: Route guide **C**ategorizes obstacles, **L**ets climbers self-resolve technical issues, **E**scalates real blockers, **A**cts on urgent blocks, **R**eviews prevention.
